tn.text: "Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: they have eyes to see but they do not see; and where they have ears to hear but do not listen
tn.text: Both of these phrases are using either eyes or ears to refer to the people's ability to learn. AT: "they have the ability to learn but choose not to" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Ezekiel is performing another of the acted-out parables.
"So this is for you"

tn.ref: Perhaps they will begin to see, though they are a rebellious house
tn.text: AT: "Maybe they will begin to understand what you are describing" The word "see" is used to refer to the Jewish people's ability to understand. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
God is speaking to Ezekiel describing how he should act out the parable.
The word "their" refers to the people of Israel.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:16|3:1]].

tn.ref: have set you as a sign
tn.text: AT: "have placed you as a correction to their thinking"
Ezekiel shows the people of Israel they will soon be forced into exile.

tn.ref: dug a hole through the wall by hand
tn.text: AT: "dug a hole through the wall with my hands"
AT: "out at night while it is dark"
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:16|3:01]].

tn.ref: Son of man, is the house of Israel, that rebellious house, not asking, 'What are you doing?
tn.text: God asks this question to Ezekiel to show that the people of Israel have noticed what Ezekiel is doing. AT: "Ezekiel, the people of Israel, the ones who disobey me, have noticed what you are doing." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
AT: "who are among them"
"at night while it is dark"

tn.ref: I will spread out my net over him and he will be caught in my snare
tn.text: The words "net" and "snare" are used because these are different ways to trap an animal. God knows what the leader of Jerusalem will do and has set up events so that he will be captured as he tries to escape. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I will bring him to Babylon
tn.text: AT: "I will cause him to be taken to Babylon"

tn.ref: I will send out a sword after them
tn.text: The word "sword" is used to refer to an army of men carrying swords. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: when I scatter them among the nations and disperse them throughout the lands
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing. AT: "when I cause them to separate from each other and live in different nations." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
The word "sword" refers to being killed in fighting. AT: "from being killed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:02:01|2:3]].

tn.ref: eat your bread with trembling, and drink your water with shaking and worry
tn.text: AT: "live your daily life with great fear." Eating and drinking are common things done in life and so tell Ezekiel to live with great fear. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: They will eat their bread with trembling and drink their water while shaking
tn.text: These two phrases share similar meanings and emphasize that the people will be very afraid, even while doing the most basic things like eating and drinking. AT: "They will live daily life with great fear." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: cities that were inhabited will be desolate
tn.text: "desolate" describes a place where no one lives. AT: "people in cities will leave or die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
See how this phrase is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:6]].
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: The days are prolonged, and every vision fails
tn.text: This was a saying of the people of Israel who did not believe that God would judge them. AT: "Many days have passed without God's judgment, the prophet's warnings are false" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This phrase refers to the days in which Israel will be judged. AT: "The days of judgment are coming soon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The visions God gives to the prophets will come true. AT: "every prophecy will happen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
Yahweh is speaking to the people of Israel.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:01|3:1]].

tn.ref: The matter will no longer be delayed
tn.text: "What I predict will happen soon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])

tn.ref: This is the Lord Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].
Possible meanings 1) "everything that I say will happen" (UDB) or 2) "speak this message" or 3) "speak this prophecy"
"while you are alive"
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: came to me ... vision that he sees ... and he prophesies
tn.text: The words "me" and "he" refer to Ezekiel.
The word "them" refers to the people of Israel.
The word "Behold" here alerts us to pay attention to the surprising information that follows.

tn.ref: The vision that he sees is for many days from now, and he prophesies of far off times
tn.text: These phrases are both ways the people of Israel are saying Ezekiel's warnings will not happen in their lifetime but will happen far in the future. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: My words will not be delayed any longer, but the word that I have spoken will be done
tn.text: These phrases are both ways God is telling the people of Israel that the things he has warned about, will happen soon. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: this is the Lord Yahweh's declaration!
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].
